notes: common irregular modal verb; often used with another verb; auxiliary avere in compounds
example_sentence_english: I want to be able to speak.
Being able to choose, I would go to the sea.
I was able to do it.
I was able to understand it.
We were able to help them.
They were able to bring them.
I can come.
You can do it.
He can do it.
We can go out.
You (plural) can speak now.
They can come.
I could help you.
You could come yesterday.
She could do it.
We could leave earlier.
You (plural) could see the film.
They could finish the work.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; compound past
example_sentence_english: I have been able to help.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; compound past
example_sentence_english: Have you been able to find the keys?

translation_english: he has been able/she has been able/you (formal) have been able
notes: used with auxiliary avere; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: He has been able to solve the problem.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; compound past
example_sentence_english: We have been able to enter.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; compound past
example_sentence_english: Have you (plural) been able to see everything?

notes: used with auxiliary avere; compound past
example_sentence_english: They have been able to leave early.

notes: passato remoto; literary or formal use
example_sentence_english: We were able to finish in time.
